intro: Chuquiraga sprengeliana var. genuina, commonly known as the Andean burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to cool, dry climates and is often found in alpine regions. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
